title: The Meeting: Part 1
description: Fred continues coordinating his junk empire with a new partner, Cal Pettie, Lamont's larger than life friend and co-worker from the Alaskan Pipeline. And into Fred's Garden of Eden steps the beautiful Eve Lewis.

title: The Meeting: Part 2
description: Fred proposes to Eve, but feels very out of place in her sophisticated social circle, especially when wearing a borrowed magician's tuxedo.

title: The Meeting: Part 3
description: After faking a heart attack to get out of his engagement, Fred realizes that he still has feelings for Eve.

title: The Still of the Night
description: Fred schemes to make easy money from Cal's smooth bourbon after discovering Cal has built a still and is making lip-smacking good moonshine using his family's secret recipe.

title: Dinner at George's
description: Big spender Fred insists on taking Eve to her favorite Beverly Hills bistro, but gets his ego bruised when Eve plots to pay the check behind his back.

title: Younger Than Springtime Am I
description: Feeling old, Fred falls for a con man's quack cure and buys a fountain of youth pill called Methusatol.

title: Retrospective: Part 1
description: While hauling junk from Eve's home, Fred and Cal are arrested on suspicion of burglary. While sitting in jail, they reminisce about their first meeting and of Fred and Eve's engagement party.

title: Retrospective: Part 2
description: Fred and Cal continue looking back and laughing at their past adventures while locked up in a Beverly Hills jail.

title: Perfect Husband
description: Fred and Eve's engagement hits a bump in the road when Eve romanticizes her late husband as an angel and a saint and flesh and blood Fred fears he can't compete.

title: The Ring
description: After being terrorized in a jewelry store robbery, Fred discovers a $12,000 diamond ring fell into his cap. While deciding whether to return or to keep the ring, Officers Hoppy and Smitty appear at the door.

title: Cissy and the Nephew
description: Aunt Esther's son Cliff comes to stay with Fred and falls fast for Eve's daughter Cissy.

title: Cal's Diet: Part 1
description: Cal is lonely and depressed about his weight, so Fred and Cliff put Cal on a diet and exercise regimen designed to build up his body and boost his sagging self confidence.

title: Cal's Diet: Part 2
description: Cal's confidence restored, Fred takes him to a swinging singles bar where Cal meets lovely Katie, meter maid.

title: The Benefit
description: Sammy Davis Jr. agrees to perform at Eve's charity benefit for the Children of Watts, but when Sammy doesn't show, Cliff, Cissy, Al and Fred take to the stage and showcase their talents.

title: Here Comes the Bride: Part 1
description: Aunt Esther returns and moves in with Fred to watch over Cliff. Cal discovers that due to an error on Fred's marriage license, Fred was actually long ago legally wed to Esther.

title: Here Comes the Bride: Part 2
description: Fred, Esther and Cal drive to Fremont, Missouri seeking a divorce, but must first plead their case before the county's irascible old judge, who is resistant to tearing asunder what God joined together.

title: Fred Has the Big One
description: After years of crying wolf, Fred suffers an actual heart attack.

title: Cal the Coward
description: When a pair of crooks threaten Fred and Cal at gunpoint, Cal can only cower in the closet. Fred cooks up a caper to give Cal the chance to prove his courage and regain his self-respect.

title: Love Is Blind
description: Fred invites Cliff and his new girlfriend Charlene to dinner, but Cliff neglects to tell Fred that Charlene is blind.

title: Cal's Mom
description: Cal's mother comes to visit and among her baggage is bigotry against blacks. A special episode addressing racial prejudice.

title: Gaslight
description: Suffering from a virus and delirious, Fred misunderstands an overheard conversation and now fears Cal is plotting to kill him.

title: Freeway
description: The city is debating whether to run a freeway through Watts or the wealthy Corban Hills neighborhood. Fred, Cal and Cliff organize their neighbors and lead the charge to save their homes.

title: Jury Duty
description: In this spoof of "12 Angry Men," Fred is the lone juror unwilling to cast a guilty verdict in a murder trial.

title: Cal's Illegal Alien
description: Cal just met a girl named Maria, but she's an illegal alien hiding in the Sanford home during a rash of immigration raids in the area.

title: Private Lives
description: Fred and Eve have a lover's quarrel with each vowing to bring a better date to the art gallery opening. Grady fixes up Fred with a bubble-headed bimbo named Bunny.

title: To Keep a Thief
description: The fourteen-year-old boy who burglarized the Sanford home is ordered to work off the amount he stole. Fred and Cal hope to scare him straight. Final episode of the series.
